subject: Re: [junit] Re: Testing several classes with the same test case
msgSnippet: ... Production classes, not test case classes. There is one test case class. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide to software
messageBody:
C?dric Beust ? wrote:
>
>
> On 8/7/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...
> <mailto:jbrains762%40gmail.com>> wrote:
>
> > > this is what I am trying to avoid. I want to have a single TestCase
> > > that is parameterized to run on any given Algorithm subclass. In your
> > > example I should create a new TestCase for each Algorighm subclass.
> > >
> > > In practice I have 10 test cases and 10 "Algorithms". The problem is
> > > that I don't want to write and support 100 test classes, bu only 10.
> >
> > You could try writing a custom suite() method that looks like this:
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Algorithm tests");
> > suite.add(new AlgorithmTest(new Algorithm1()));
> > ...
> > suite.add(new AlgorithmTest(new Algorithm99())));
>
> This still requires the creation of 100 classes instead of 10, right?

Production classes, not test case classes. There is one test case class.
